sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Transcripts (16th century) of British Medieval Charters, Chronicles and Letters
Chartae Transcriptae. Miscellanea
msDesc.p: Paper and vellum, 325 247 12.75 x 9.5. Seculo xvi scriptus.

msContents.textLang: Latin, Middle English, Old English, English and Anglo-Norman.
msContents.label: Contents

msItem.head: Henry of Huntingdon, Epistola ad Warinum de regibus Britonum

head.title: Epistola Henrici de Huntingdon ad Warinum de regibus Britonum

ab.quote: Haec continentur in fine historiae Sigisberti Gemblacensis per Robertum de Torineio abbatem S. Michaelis de Monte in Normannia quondam priorem coenobii Beccensis

msItem.ab: On three vellum leaves in Joscelyn's hand(?) perhaps from Domitian VIII, Hardy II 275

ab.quote: Deest prefatio, sed ad finem habentur xx cap. de mirabilibus Britanniae, insulae Monae, et Hiberniae a Cl. Gale non edita

msItem.ab: Copied from MS 139, see Mommsen's ed., p. 125

msItem.head: Caradog of Llancarfen, Vita Sancti Gildae

head.title: Vita sanctissimi atque devotissimi viri Gildae a Caradoco Nancarbanensi scripta

ab.quote: Nihil memorabile continet haec historia pseudo-miraculis referta, nisi quod duo opera, unum quatuor evangelistarum, alterum de historiis Britanniae, Gildae tribuit

msItem.ab: Also from MS 139, Mommsen, p. 107

msItem.head: Ælfric OSB, Old English Preface to Genesis. Genesis c. I-XXIV

head.title: Geneseωs capita xxiv priora Saxonice per Ælfricum

ab.quote: Versioni praefigitur, Ad scripturarum lectionem exhortatio sumpta ex sermone B. Augustini de tempore: hanc vero excipit epistola Ælfrici.

msItem.ab: In Anglo-Saxon character: from University Library Ii. 1. 33, ending
msItem.explicit: et gildene biagas god herie Noe

head.title: Injunction of Henry VI against papal legates entering the kingdom without licence, 1428
Protestatio facta nomine Henrici VI, ne quis legatus ingrediatur regnum sine licentia ipsius 1428

ab.quote: In primordis hujus regni, optimates in diversas abierunt partes, alii duci de Glocestria, alii cardinali de Beaufort se addicentes, dum igitur de summa potestate inter se disceptabant, apostolicae sedis legatus nominatus est cardinalis, veritus autem Glocestrensis ne nova autoritate ad perturbandum rempublicam uteretur, hanc protestationem regis nomine fieri fecit

msItem.rubric: Extractum ex libro antiquo ecclesie Cantuariensis: quae habet (?incipit). Incipit registrum Willelmi prioris ecclesie Christi Cantuariensis
msItem.ab: Is this Molassh's Register, now Bodleian MS. Tanner 165? in Parker's time it belonged to W. Bowyer

msItem.head: Dispute concerning the patronage of the church of Haveking

head.title: Quod ecclesia de Haveking injuste et invito legitimo patrono data est prioratui de Folk per Willelmum de Averanches

ab.quote:
This president is to be sene in the leiger of the late dissolved monastery of St. Radagund the virgin nere Dover under this title, Compositio super decimas, which lieger booke remaineth and is to be sene with me Thomas Honywood.
Per me Thomam Honywood propria manu.

head.title: Charters of Battle Abbey

Charta abbatis et conventus de Bello qua assignaverunt sacristae suo de Bello 40s. annuatim de reditu manerii de Wy in perpetuum ad faciend. singulis annis anniversarium Magistri Willelmi de Bruneford quondam vicarii de Wy, data 6 Julii 1299

ab.quote:
Sequuntur notae quaedam de aliis in eodem libro contentis, viz.
Ex eodem libro inter cartas de decimis mentio fit quod Aeilƿi et Aethelida dederunt decimam suam de Bromham cum filio suo Benedicto, qui effectus est monachus, absque omni calumnia in perpetuum tenendam.
Inter cartas de Haukeherste habetur carta Roberti filii Willelmi de Hastings, qui dedit ecclesiae S. Martini de Bello et monachis ibidem ad missas celebrandas totam decimam vini de vinea sua de Celingham.
Inter cartas episcoporum Moyses quidem prior Coventriae nominatur, et ibidem habetur confirmatio Iohannis Cantuariensis archiepiscopi de ecclesia de Wy cum decimis et pensione quinque solidorum ab ecclesia de Haukeherste.
Hunc librum mutuandum dedit pro tempore quidam minister ex sacello regio vocatus Hottofte.

msItem.ab: Mentioned in Monasticon III 238 note

head.title: Quod Ricardus de Willaston clericus, qui desponsavit Margaritam de Attwell, admissus est ad unum cotagium, etc.

msItem.ab: Has a note by Parker that this record was exhibited to him by T. B. of Litchfield and Coventre, 27 May 1568 at Lambith.

msItem.ab: Mentioned in Monasticon III 238 note

head.title: Excerptum ex Ioanne Sarisburiensi, Metalogicon lib. iv, cap. 42. de eadem re
Extract from Cardinal Poole's speech before the king and queen on the lordship of Ireland
Extract from Cardinal Poole's speech before the king and queen to the same purpose
Lands pertaining to the King of Scotland
Terrae pertinentes ad regem Scotiae
Derivation of proper names terminating in son

msItem.ab: All theis names in son as Hobbeson, Jackson, Johnson, Willson, etc. are of the northe and the first of that name was a bastarde so named after their fathers forname ad differentiam legittimorum nominatorum by the Sir name. And if the father were unknowen then had those bastardes theire names of theire mothers as Margetson, Hellenson, Jhoanson, Tybson, etc. quod Sir Thomas Heye ex traditione

head.title: Proverbs, and rules for grafting

msItem.incipit:
De pullo equino:
If thy foale haue iiij white feete kepe hym but one daye
If he haue iij white feete put him sone awaie.
If he haue but ij white feete put him to thy frende
If he haue but one white foote kepe him to his lyves ende
msItem.ab: iij Thinges suffreth mikell sorowe. A childes birde, A Pedders horse and a Knaves wife
Rules for grafting ('Griffes')

begins

A te Richarde mors iam superata fuisset

msItem.ab: This last was a volume included in Parker's list of books given to the College but marked by John Parker as missing. I have recently discovered that this MS. is now in the Lambeth Palace Library, no. 1213.

Tempora quibus monasteria fundabantur

msItem.ab: From the Eulogium Historiarum (Trinity R. 7. 2, p. 663)
On p. 432 are notes by Parker including a list of eminent men named Matthew, and some rhyming adages, e.g.: A proverbe in Norfolke

lg.l: At St Dunstones daie laie the seede leape awane
Is ther non yet a raine take the seede leape againe

head.title: Epistola Rabbi Samuelis Judei ad Rabbi Ysaac Judeum de prophetiis veteris Testamenti
Epistola Rabbi Samuelis Judei ad Rabbi Ysaac Judeum de prophetiis veteris Testamenti translata de Arabico in Latinum per fratrem Alfonsum Boni Hominis Hyspanum ordinis praedicatorum

ab.quote: typis impressa

msItem.ab: After 61 is a leaf (pp. 445 - 446) of vellum with the following matter
recto. Cent. xiii-xiv. List of Bishops in England and Wales, number of knights' fees etc.
Cent. xv

Iste liber diuiditur in xii partes ut patet in subsequent'
Prima pars continet
De bello Runciuall etc.
Duodecima
De Rege Stephano etc.
verso, cent. xiv?

Hec cont. in isto libro. Liber Turpini. De presb. Iohanne. Nomina episcoporum et archiep. Liber Merlini. De mirabilibus Brittannie. Quot annis planete suum implent cursum. Historia anglie. Vita Ricardi Regis. Et gesta pontificum

head.title: Old English Charters of Leofric to Exeter Cathedral
Carta Saxonica de terris ornamentis vestimentis et libris quos Leofricus episcopus dedit ecclesiae cathedralis Exoniae ex quodam recordo ejusdem ecclesiae

msItem.ab: Printed in Dugdale Monasticon II 527; Warren, Leofric Missal etc.
Loose in the book is a bit of a letter in Latin evidently to Parker, shortly after Bucer's death which was on Feb. 28, 1550-1

Gratiam et salutem in domino foelicissimam ex animo tibi amantissime tutor exopto. Tradidi omnia que a famulo tuo acceperam Mro Cheke tui et mei atq. omnium studiosorum amicissimo pro quibus tibi a me magnas gratias agi voluit petit etiam magnopere tuae concionis exemplar ad eum quamprimo deferri quo tua etiam testificatio de integerrima vita et foelicissima morte doctoris et magistri nostri buceri ad perpetuam hominis et memorie suae commendationem posteritati tradendam, possit accedere ac plurimum valere
Verso (ends of lines cut off)

non egi adhuc cum Mro Checo de libro D. B(uceri) cui de (regno?)... christi inscribitur remigio ad excudendum traden... de eo igitur deinceps quando erit oportunum.... Scio non te latere episcopum rofensem designatum esse n... Winton. dimidia tamen pars praediorum eum latebit... habebit tamen vt audio duo mille marcarum in sing ... Aliquot coniecti sunt in le fleet quia missam audiuerunt... vt aiunt Mr Antonius Bro...
Loose in the volume are also

a. A drawing on vellum of the porch of the Chapel erected by the widow of Sir Nicholas Bacon in 1583-4 and destroyed by Wilkins (see Masters's History, p. 208 and Willis and Clark I 292). The materials of the different portions are noted on the drawing
b. A part of a Roll of College Accounts for 1751

recordHist.p: remarks: Items listed at end as loose in the volume are now no longer present (at least, not photographed) - SP 17/08/09.
